AND three (3) years of professional level experience in public sector administration support and one (1) of the required three (3) years of experience must include lead or supervisory responsibilities.Supplemental InformationKnowledge of: City organization, operations, policies, and procedures.City Code, City Ordinances and Operating Manuals.Principles and practices of office administration.Records management principles.Telephone etiquette protocol.Customer service standards and protocols.Principles and methods of supervision and training.Business computers and standard MS Office software applications.Skill in: Providing highly skilled secretarial support to executive – level personnel.Preparing correspondence, agendas and various types of documents.Organizing and maintaining departmental records and filing systems.Answering incoming calls and responding to public inquiries.Coordinating special projects in support of administrative operations.Operating a personal computer utilizing a variety of business software.Explaining City policies and procedures.Communicating effectively verbally and in writing.Dealing tactfully and courteously with elected officials, employees and the public.Establishing and maintaining cooperative working relationships with elected officials, managers, fellow employees, and the public.LICENSE AND CERTIFICATION REQUIREMENTS: A valid California State Driver’s License may be required.PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORKING ENVIRONMENT:  Work is performed in a standard office environment.SELECTION PROCESS:  Completed application packets will be reviewed and only the first 100 qualified applicants whose qualifications best meet or exceed the requirements of the position and needs of the City, will be invited to participate further in the selection process, which may include, a written exam and a panel interview. Candidates must be specific and complete in describing their qualifications for the position. Failure to state all pertinent information may lead to elimination from consideration. Applications must be submitted online. If you submit multiple applications, only the most recent application will be considered. Copies of required certifications must be submitted with the application. Stating "see resume" is not an acceptable substitution for a completed application. To view the complete job description, please visit our website at www.cityofvernon.org. job_description:
All positions are 100% remote.
We are currently hiring in the US, with the exception of New York, Hawaii, and California.
Why Delegate you may ask. What makes us unique? First, we live our core values. Our leadership and our team truly has an innate spirit of helping others, we have an enthusiasm for excellence, we are kind and thoughtful, we do what we say, and we are transparent! Our company takes a teamed approach so you're never working alone, even though you're remote! Delegate offers unlimited paid time off, paid holidays, and insurance. Not only are our team members W-2 employees (not contractors), but we are salaried! You can count on a consistent paycheck.
FREEDOM. Our core purpose at Delegate is to create FREEDOM for people to do what they love and have a big impact. That includes both our clients and our team.
Our clients have a million things on their to do lists every day. They have calls and meetings that need to be scheduled, emails that need to be managed, research that needs to be conducted, and the list goes on and on. Since they are entrepreneurs, their lists are also always changing. They turn to us to help them run the back offices of their businesses and support them while they grow. They want us to help move things forward and provide creative solutions to simplify complexities to help them be as efficient as possible.
TEAMWORK. At Delegate, we believe in working together through a team-based approach. Typically, our clients are paired with two assistants. Once they meet with their client and agree upon a plan of action, one assistant works strategically on the big picture goals while the other implements and completes the day-to-day tasks. This holistic approach allows our clients to feel the impact we make everyday while bringing their long-term vision to life! This approach also allows our team members the flexibility to take time off knowing that their teammate has them covered!
Requirements:
Our Virtual Executive Assistants play a critical role in client satisfaction. We believe in high-end service delivery, strong attention to detail, and excellent follow through which ensures the client’s highest priorities and needs are exceeded on a daily basis. Whether you are the team member that takes the traditional day-to-day task execution or the one that works on the strategic process and project planning, our team members must be able to proactively identify opportunities to leverage client time effectively and be fully committed to the growth of the client’s business.
This position requires weekly video meetings with clients, recurring internal video team meetings, and daily availability during business hours. It allows for great flexibility in how you structure your day and your time within that framework.
 Demonstrated Abilities In:

Virtual work environment
Managing multiple accounts, timelines and projects
Proactively identifying trends and opportunities for growth
Managing resources
Critical thinking and sound decision making
Relationship building long-term relationships
Working on teams and in a professional environment
GSuite, internet and technology savvy


Basic & Technical Requirements

Daily availability from 9a.m. - 5p.m., Monday through Friday (some off-peak work needed on a client-by-client basis)
A noise-free private home office with a door
Webcam
Smartphone
MAC or PC Desktop computer or laptop (no tablets or notebooks) with a current version of MS Office
Minimum 1.0GHz dual-core processor
Minimum 8GB RAM
Operating System: Windows 8, 8.1 or 10. MAC at least Catalina v10
Anti-virus, anti-spyware, and firewall must be to up to date and maintained regularly
Reliable Internet with at least 10 mbps speed test download (1.8mbps upload)


Benefits
Please take the time to go through our website, before completing the application form. You'll get an in-depth look at who we are, what we do, and the kinds of clients we work with.
Salaried Exempt Position

Unlimited PTO after 90-days

Paid Holidays

Eligible for Health Benefits after 30 days

Short-Term / Long-Term Disability Insurance

Supplemental Life Insurance

Bonuses
At Delegate, we value diversity and are an Equal Opportunity Employer.

job_title: newVICE PRESIDENT OF SYSTEMS AND IT
summary:
Take ownership and commit to it.
Job Title: Vice President of Systems and IT.
Reports To: Chief Operations Officer.
Strong strategic and business mindset.
job_description:
Job Title: Vice President of Systems and IT
 Reports To: Chief Operations Officer
 FLSA Status: Exempt
 Department: Systems and IT
 Benefits: Eligible
Position Summary:
Blue Stream Fiber is Florida’s fastest growing Fiber-to-the-Home provider of highly reliable Internet, TV, and Phone services to both residential and business customers. At our core, we are a customer focused organization that prides ourselves on our entrepreneurial spirit, strong company culture and ability to deliver time and time again. To help us continue our growth and ensure that we maintain strong customer and employee satisfaction, we are looking for an experienced Vice President of Systems and IT to oversee our critical back-office systems, platforms, and IT. In this role you will work to create a unified employee and customer experience by leading the integration of our systems, implementing automation, and motivating a collaborative and fast paced team.
Responsibilities:
Evaluate the needs of customers and employees and develop a strategic execution plan to drive improvements across the organization.
Select, implement, and integrate technology within a live working environment.
Develop and maintain a three-year roadmap for systems, automation and integration that aligns with the company’s desire to constantly drive growth, improve customer satisfaction, and make employee roles and tasks more repeatable and efficient.
Run end-to-end RFPs for new software selection and negotiate with vendors in pricing and key service levels.
Partner with other cross functional leaders to evaluate the needs of their organizations.
Assist key department leaders evaluate systems for automation, reporting and tracking to efficiently implement those systems.
Partner with our COO and CEO on our IT strategy to communicate and deliver our company technology vision.
Lead, manage and develop an internal team as well as leverage and manage vendors and external service providers to deploy new solutions on time.
Create top-down accountability within IT and develop a team that will support and manage Blue Stream Fiber’s current and future business needs.
Manage Blue Stream Fiber’s IT Budget and work closely with CFO to develop new annual budgets.
Track planned vs actual expenditure across your project portfolio.
Lead the technology evaluation, selection, and implementations across the company to streamline all internal operations.
Manage and guide the information technology team in the design and customization process across multiple software platforms, ensuring data accuracy, real-time dashboards and KPI’s that will enable our business units to better manage their own objectives.
Drive our on-going development of a central data warehouse to support enhanced analytics and reporting across the company.
Safeguard a robust communications infrastructure with LAN/WAN topologies designed for efficiency and reliability.
Monitor uptime and performance of all infrastructure and applications to ensure service levels are met.
Develop, drive alignment, and realize a cybersecurity strategy that balances the risk tolerance Blue Stream Fiber has with the present cybersecurity risk posture.
Operate cybersecurity tools, review cybersecurity metrics, policies and provide regular updates to the COO concerning the state of cybersecurity and progress realizing the cybersecurity strategy.
Design and create information security and processes such as vulnerability management, incident response, event monitoring and other guidelines.
Establish a culture of continuous improvement and enhance operational maturity.
Lead a team responsible for continually evaluating advancements in technology appropriate to the industry.
Desired Skills/Abilities:
Proven experience designing, developing IT systems and planning IT implementations.
Solid understanding of financial data analysis, budgeting, vendor management and business operations is imperative.
Strong record of successful project and change management.
Very strong background researching IT innovation.
Expert knowledge of software systems and infrastructure.
Successful record of managing and developing a strong, collaborative IT team.
Poses the ability to be coached and mentored by other leaders across the organization and a proven record of being a team player.
Demonstrated knowledge and familiarity with incident handling, threat intelligence, security architecture & Design and cybersecurity technology trends Minimum of ten years’ experience in Information Technology.
Previous experience in Salesforce preferred or similar CRM programs.
Previous experience with ICOMMS software preferred or similar programs.
Previous experience with Tableau or PowerBI beneficial.
General Qualifications/Education:
Experience developing or supporting the development of a cybersecurity strategy.
Minimum of Three years’ experience as a VP or leader in an IT department leading both application and infrastructure teams.
BS/BA in computer science, MSCP or relevant field experience.
CISSP, CISM, SANS GIAC series and other certifications that demonstrate a commitment to continued professional information security advancement preferred.
Excellent organizational and leadership skills.
Superior analytical and problem-solving capabilities.
Strong strategic and business mindset.
Outstanding communication and interpersonal abilities.
Physical Demands/Working Conditions:
The physical demands are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Why Join the Blue Stream Team?
Blue Stream Fiber has been in business for over 40 years, servicing Florida with amazing Internet, TV, and Phone products. We have invested millions of dollars building fiber in the communities we serve to deliver an innovative array of products and services, including fiber-to-the-home infrastructure, symmetrical internet speeds, whole-home managed Wi-Fi, and TiVo Android Set-Top boxes with Google Assistant, among other industry-leading technology. As our company grows throughout the state of Florida, our support staff needs to grow and evolve, and that is exactly why we need you. At Blue Stream Fiber we take a customized approach to ensure our customers are at the center of every decision we make, all while developing each of our team member’s strengths and experiences.
People:
We take our role as trusted industry experts very seriously. We provide communities and our neighbors with reliable fiber infrastructure to offer world-class internet, TV and phone products and services that enrich lives, while providing a personalized customer experience from a local team that cares. We are a united team that operates following a clear set of core values that guide us in our everyday actions.
Key Competencies:
Accountable:
Take ownership and commit to it.
Inclusive:
Able to work in a collaborative style that highlights strengths, pushes you to reach your highest potential, and ensures an enjoyable and rewarding experience for all.
Innovative:
Be resourceful, creative, hungry, humble, and smart to develop world class products, services, and solutions.
Respectful:
Hold every assignment with regard for our customers and each other.
Personal Integrity:
Be open, honest, and transparent with yourself, coworkers, customers, and stakeholders in every action.
Diverse:
Embrace unique thought processes to assist in making well-rounded decisions that ultimately benefits our team and our customers.

Install, configure, manage, maintain, test, evaluate, and repair computer networks, workstations, support server system(s), supporting hardware/software, user accounts, and computer/telephone rooms. summary:
The Town of Nags Head has an exciting opportunity for an Information Technology Administrator!
This position is the primary resource for the Town’s technology…
job_description:
Information Technology Administrator


Calling IT Professionals! The Town of Nags Head has an exciting opportunity for an Information Technology Administrator! This position is the primary resource for the Town’s technology needs. The IT Administrator is responsible for system maintenance, providing end-user technical support and training, liaising with IT vendors and troubleshooting hardware and software system issues. This position will also research and recommend new technology that will help improve efficiency and create a collaboration centric IT environment for end-users. This is a unique opportunity for someone that wants to make a real impact on Town operations!


Responsibilities

Plans, organizes and develops IT system recommendations to improve the productivity of the Town; serves as liaison with the contract technology vendor to address issues and ensure quality service; researches and evaluates software; assists with preparation of RFPs and evaluating proposals; coordinates integration with existing system; coordinates new software training with vendors.
Provides technical support to users of the Town's organization; provides trouble shooting for complex hardware and software issues; provides user training.
Provides SharePoint development and administration support, including end-user training
Supports GIS content, website interfaces and development.
Coordinates with departments to determine needs; develops annual budget for technology and monitors expenditures; researches solutions, software and other technology; prepares replacement schedules and recommends leases or purchases.
Applies for and administers grants.
Manages video conferencing software applications and operates cameras and software to stream meetings.
Sets up and maintains user accounts including Active Directory, email, spam filtering, passwords, file shares, phone systems, etc.; coordinates overlapping issues with vendor.
Works with managers to plan and implement long and short-range automation needs of the various Town departments and their needed applications; participates with departments in the budget and purchases of hardware, software, peripherals, etc.
Researches technology solutions and IT best practices for Town use; evaluates effectiveness of IT systems, policies and workflows; analyzes and makes recommendations for system, application and communication upgrades and replacements.
Coordinates the use of town equipment such as laptops, tablets, MiFis and other loaned devices.
Performs other duties as required


Required Qualifications

5 years of related IT experience
Associate’s Degree with a major in information technology, or closely related field and considerable experience user support, preferably in systems administration in the public sector; or an equivalent combination of education, certifications and experience.
Knowledge of information systems technology and trends in hardware, software, operating systems, and various application available and in use.
Knowledge of computer equipment installation, security, anti-virus, preventative maintenance and troubleshooting techniques.
Knowledge of information technology principles, terminology, mathematics, and logic.
Knowledge of systems analysis and computer operational policies, procedures and practices.
Knowledge in network and system security.
Ability to plan and organize work productively and independently; set and follow effective work priorities; and meet established deadlines.
Willingness to keep current and actively seek new information and technology in this rapidly changing field.


Desired Qualifications

Experience with SharePoint maintenance and development
Experience with the ESRI product line including ArcGIS
Experience with MUNIS
Experience with Windows operating environments

FLSA Status

Exempt


The Town of Nags Head is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Emburse has offices across North America, including Los Angeles, Montreal, Portland (ME), San Diego, San Francisco, and Toronto, as well as locations in the UK, Germany, Spain, Australia and the Netherlands.

Our core values - Sincerity, Empathy, Empowerment, Individuality, and Teamwork - reflect who we are as a company. They are central to the decisions we make and the interactions we have with our teams, customers, and partners. As a people-focused company, we are seeking candidates who align with our values.

These awards celebrate companies that have gone above and beyond to provide their communities, clients, and front-line workers with support during the COVID-19 pandemic. We are a people-first company, and this award is a testament to our mission to humanize work.
Follow us to stay updated on news and job openings!
Support Engineers are responsible for receiving cases from production environment monitoring tools as well as directly from Production clients during their usage of Emburse products and providing the appropriate service to address those inquiries. Cases may consist of questions related to product functionality, reports of the product not working as expected, system availability, third-party integrations, and/or other topics related to access, configuration and usage. Support Engineers address these cases through: providing prompt communication with customers through various channels; testing, troubleshooting and analysis; research or internal consultation on product functionality; performing administration or configuration tasks via internal tools; transferring or escalating issues to another internal group when appropriate.
What you'll do:

Provide an exemplary customer service experience to internal and external stakeholders
Intermittently work weekend and off-hours rotation
#LI-IH

job_description:
The Opportunity

We are looking for a Security Analyst to join our frontline cybersecurity defense team. As a Security Analyst, you will be responsible for identifying, catching, and preventing email fraud by efficiently handling a high volume of requests and applying policies.


Who You Are
Detail-oriented and passionate about cybersecurity
Positive attitude
Comfortable working in a fast-paced and virtual environment
Ability to communicate clearly in both verbal and written communication methods
Active listener


What You'll Do
Perform operational tasks, such as handling high volume intake queues or labeling machine learning data, in a timely manner
Propose improvements for processes, workflows, product and policies
Support investigation efforts across a range of critical issues
Learn about email fraud attack strategies and patterns to prevent an event from occurring


Experience you'll need
Typically requires less than 1 year of related experience
Typically requires a Bachelor's degree, or working towards Bachelor's degree
Proficiency with G Suite (Google) applications
Familiarity with Zoom


Why Abnormal Security
Hourly salary: $20.19 and stock options
Overtime opportunities
Full medical, dental, and vision health insurance benefits with life insurance, FSA, and 401k opportunities
WFH stipends including phone, wellness and equipment
Generous PTO
Team-wide commitment to excellence, velocity, and customer-focus
Best-in-class customer traction and growth


More About Abnormal Security

Abnormal Security is defining the next generation of email security defense. Our platform uses machine learning and artificial intelligence to baseline communication content, user identity, and behavioral signals in real-time and at-scale in order to detect the abnormalities of email attacks. Customers love us because we consistently detect and stop what everyone else in the market can't - advanced attacks that have never been seen before - and we do so with beautiful user interfaces and best-in-industry customer support.


Our veteran team has built some of the most enduring machine learning platforms at leading companies including Google, Twitter, Pinterest, Amazon, Microsoft, and Expanse. We are located in San Francisco,CA, New York, NY and Lehi, UT.


Our company is growing - we're on the Forbes AI 50, selected as a Gartner 2020 Cool Vendor, and our customer base includes multiple Fortune 500 companies.

summary: Applicants with an active license issued by the Department of Professional and Occupational Regulation (DPOR) may be required to place their license in an…
company: Virginia Dept of Professional & Occ Reg
job_description:
The Department of Professional and Occupational Regulation (DPOR) is an executive branch agency under the Secretary of Labor for the Commonwealth of Virginia. Our regulatory boards are comprised of practitioners and citizens appointed by the Governor and are responsible for regulating certain professions and occupations, ranging from architects and contractors to cosmetologists and professional wrestlers. DPOR supports Virginia’s economic vitality by helping qualified people start businesses and work in their chosen fields. We protect the public by verifying minimum competency, investigating complaints, and upholding professional compliance with state law and regulations.

The Department of Professional and Occupational Regulation is seeking a qualified individuals to provide and coordinate administrative and business support in all aspects of an assigned section’s boards and licensing programs. This position serves as the primary point of contact for board members, attorneys, other intra-agency divisions, government officials, and the general public. Administrative support is provided by this position to the Executive Director of the section and Board Administrators within the section.

The Administrative Coordinator is responsible for preparing minutes for meetings, composing correspondence and written information regarding board related topics, and responding to inquiries regarding board actions and information from minutes, orders, agreements, and database information. Compiling data, preparing written reports, and creating forms and charts that clearly convey information are also required of this position. This position files all proper meeting and hearing notices and makes all arrangements necessary for meetings and other board functions, including coordinating IT needs for the meetings. This position handles preparation of disciplinary and licensing cases for Board review, and conducts appropriate follow-up, including monitoring compliance with any orders or agreements entered by the boards.

Currently the agency is recruiting to fill three Administrative Coordinator positions for the following board sections:
Common Interest Community Board; Board for Asbestos, Lead and Home Inspectors; and the Board for Waterworks and Wastewater Works Operators and Onsite Sewage System Professionals
Board for Barbers and Cosmetology; Board for Hearing Aid Specialists and Opticians
Board for Architects, Professional Engineers, Land Surveyors, Certified Interior Designers and Landscape Architects


Note: An additional requirement for applying for this position is detailed in the “Special Instructions to Applicants” below. Be sure to follow the instructions provided below, and be advised that if the proper document is not attached to your submitted application through this system, then your application will not be reviewed for this position.

TELEWORK OPTIONS: Please note that while this position is eligible for telework, this is not a full-time telework position.


Minimum Qualifications
Knowledge of assigned regulatory programs, operations, and administrative processes and procedures
Ability to perform a wide variety of moderate to complex program and administrative support duties
Strong administrative, organizational, and clerical skills
Ability to perform routine office support activities
Ability to compose clear, concise, and grammatically correct documents
Ability to read and apply regulations, statutes, policies, and procedures
Strong computer skills (specifically Microsoft Office)
Working knowledge of use of database systems
Effective time management skills
Strong oral and written communication skills, including conveying information to others effectively and understanding written and oral information provided by others
Ability to pay close attention to detail and provide accurate, error-free information and guidance in person, over the telephone, and in writing
Ability to coordinate, procure, and obtain necessary equipment, facilities, materials, and services needed to accomplish the boards’ business operations in compliance with applicable procurement requirements
Knowledge of business procedures, office procedures, and office equipment and its proper usage
Ability to maintain discretion when handling confidential and sensitive matters
Ability to research and gather facts, analyze findings, reach logical conclusions, and recommend solutions
Ability to independently identify and prioritize problems and make improvements related to administrative and business processes
High school diploma or equivalent and good understanding of English principles and office management required.
Experience handling multiple tasks, priorities, and deadlines.
Experience in meeting planning, progressively managing administrative projects and business operations, office practices, and customer services or equivalent combination of education/experience


Preferred Qualifications
Knowledge of Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) preferred
Experience preparing print materials (brochures, flyers, newsletters) preferred.
Experience in a regulatory environment preferred.
Additional coursework and/or training related to English, grammar, and/or business writing is preferred.


Special Requirements
ADDITIONAL DOCUMENT REQUIRED: (See Special Instructions to Applicants)

VETERAN STATUS: When applying for this employment opportunity, if you indicate you are a veteran, please provide a copy of your DD214 to personnel@dpor.virginia.gov prior to the job posting closing.

LAY OFF POLICY: If you have been affected by DHRM Policy 1.3 Layoff, and possess a valid Interagency Placement Screening Form (Yellow Card) or a Preferential Hiring Form (Blue Card), you must submit a copy of the card to personnel@dpor.virginia.gov prior to the job posting closing.

ELECTRONIC APPLICATIONS OR RESUMES ONLY: DPOR does not accept mailed, emailed, faxed, or hand delivered applications or resumes.

BACKGROUND INVESTIGATIONS: Final candidates are subject to a background investigation. The investigation may include: local agency checks, criminal record check, driving record, employment verification, verification of education, and other checks requested by the hiring authority related to the position. Please be advised if the information gathered does not coincide with the information listed on your application, your application will no longer be considered for the position.

LICENSES: Applicants must disclose any current professional or occupational registration, certification, and license(s) held by DPOR. Applicants with an active license issued by the Department of Professional and Occupational Regulation (DPOR) may be required to place their license in an inactive status while employed with the agency. Additional information may be provided by the Human Resources Office.

Veterans, AmeriCorps, Peace Corps, and other national service alumni and people with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

DPOR is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

The IT Systems Coordinator is responsible for answering inquiries, providing advice, troubleshooting and assisting customers in solving technology related problems to provide efficient and effective problem identification and resolution for the Houston Rockets and the Houston Toyota Center.

summary: Through single-cell biology, computational biology, and artificial intelligence, Immunai is reprogramming the immune system to develop improved drugs and…
job_description:
Position – IT/System Administrator
Mission Statement
Through single-cell biology, computational biology, and artificial intelligence, Immunai is reprogramming the immune system to develop improved drugs and therapeutics.
Background
Just two years after its founding, biotech startup Immunai has raised over $215 million.
Immunai is a fast-paced, innovative startup operating at the intersection of cancer immunology and artificial intelligence. We are a multidisciplinary team of computer scientists, engineers, immunologists, physicians, AI scientists, computational biologists, operators, and entrepreneurs singularly focused on solving the audacious challenge of mapping the human immune system. Backed by some of the leading scientific minds in immunology, oncology, and single cell genomics, we are up for the challenge.
Immunai has begun building AMICA (the “Annotated Multi-omic Immune Cell Atlas”) by mapping millions of immune cells and their functions. This atlas will play an important role in developing novel therapeutics and diagnostics in numerous disease areas, including oncology and autoimmune disorders.
The immune system, with its trillions of cells and thousands of cell types and states, has been impossible to decode until now; we believe recent advances in single cell genomics, ML, and high-performance compute will open up new understanding in how drugs interact with immune cells, and how the cells in turn interact with disease. These insights will, in turn, be used to boost clinical response to different therapies.
Location - New York, NY, US
For details - www.immunai.com, shlomit@immunai.com
Responsibilities
Set up accounts and workstations
Install and configure software and hardware
Ensure security through access controls, backups, and firewalls
Be the first line of handling new/unforeseen IT concerns
Monitor performance and maintain systems according to requirements
Set up systems to address routine IT concerns
Monitoring & analyzing office and network connectivity. Troubleshoot issues and outages
Working closely with the IL office.
Manage network servers and technology tools
Upgrade systems with new releases and models
Develop expertise to train staff on new technologies
Build technical documentation, manuals, and IT policies
Requirments
Experience with 3+ years in IT, which include knowledge of FW/Storage/Network/Cyber
Knowledge of system security (e.g. intrusion detection systems) and data backup/recovery
Experience with databases, networks (LAN, WAN), and patch management
Familiarity with various operating systems and platforms
Experience managing geographically distributed projects/contractors.
Having carried hands-on IT tasks (e.g., setting up computers/fixing random bugs)
Can-do approach and a team player
Proven track record of initiating and leading infrastructure projects from start to completion.
Multi-Tasking skills and ability to work under pressure.
Professionalism, courtesy, and motivation to provide support.
Desired Personal traits
You want to make an impact on humankind
You prioritize “We” over “I”
You enjoy getting things done - with super high quality
You collaborate effectively with people of diverse backgrounds and cultures
You have superior skills and experience, and constantly strive to be world-class in what you do
You constantly challenge your own assumptions, pushing for continuous improvement
You have a growth mindset
You make decisions that favor the company, not yourself or your team
You are candid, authentic, and transparent

summary:

You will use metrics and analysis to help leadership understand…
job_description:
This role may also be located in our Playa Vista, CA campus.
Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Mountain View, CA, USA; Chicago, IL, USA; Los Angeles, CA, USA.
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Statistics, a related quantitative field, or equivalent practical experience
4 years of experience in financial planning and analysis (FP&A), consulting, or a related function
Preferred qualifications:

Experience with database querying and analysis
Experience in or supporting internal recruiting or HR
Knowledge of accounting and core finance processes and standard finance systems
Effective problem-solving, analytical, and modeling skills, including the ability to work with team leads to frame problems, structure analyses, and drive impact
Excellent analytical and quantitative modeling skills
About the job
This role is part of the Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A) function and provides financial and analytical insights and business planning support to Worldwide Staffing and People Services Operations for all of Google’s employees. In this role, you will provide analysis, create dashboards for reporting, and partner with executives.
You will balance accounts, create a robust reporting methodology for the People Operations function through dashboarding and reporting, and be a business partner by effectively optimizing the cost and efficiencies of these programs. You will use metrics and analysis to help leadership understand the financial implications of their strategies, facilitate trade-offs discussions, and help identify opportunities to optimize investments in key programs.
Our team's goal is to be advocates of the business and trusted advisors. We do this by ensuring wise resource allocation, driving intelligent scenario planning, and helping our business leaders identify opportunities to improve operations. We develop financial forecasts, monitor key performance indicators, and drive the scaling and automation of financial processes.
The name Google came from "googol," a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team when providing in depth analysis on all manner of strategic decisions across Google products. From developing forward-thinking analysis to generating management reports to scaling our automated financial processes, the Finance organization is an important partner and advisor to the business.
Responsibilities
Analyze spend management, including purchase order approval/management, accruals and re-classes, spend trajectory and forecast updates, loading budgets, supporting corporate FP&A requests, and support the annual plan process.
Create reporting, including budgeting/forecasting and variance analysis, headcount tracking, and payroll analysis. Design scorecards and dashboards and create standard reporting packages. Develop operational metrics and associated reporting, conducting ad-hoc analysis/inquiries.
Collaborate with and influence complex partner relationships with leadership, Corporate Finance, and People Operations Services teams.
Standardize processes, align financial reports/results decks, document business processes, build extended workforce processes, and drive allocation improvements and reporting. Help create and implement process efficiency and share of best practices.
Create and update training material for business partners, and roll out finance tools.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the worlds best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast.
Job Summary
This is a work from home opportunity. Customer Care Techs are responsible for providing superior technical support & service to our small and medium business customers by promptly answering inquiries, providing accurate information while troubleshooting and problem solving with customers. Contributes to projects as required. Has developed specialized knowledge/skills in own area. May act as a resource for colleagues with less experience.
Job Description
Core Responsibilities
Provides prompt resolution to customers via telephone and/or e-mail to assist with a variety of customer inquiries and issues.
Strives for First Call Resolution while handling all issues with urgency, ownership and accountability.
Performs complex diagnostic troubleshooting to resolve voice, video & data service issues.
Responsible for fulfilling client requests to make changes to their Comcast Business Class Services including voice, video & data products.
Leverages a variety of software applications to manage customer account information and diagnose and resolve technical difficulties.
Identifies opportunities for process improvements & recommends solutions to leadership.
Communicate effectively with customers in a professional manner while setting accurate expectations for issue resolution.
Recognizes and diffuses difficult customer situations utilizing all resources, interpersonal and negotiating skills to come to resolution.
Ability to articulate relevant information regarding billing cycles, processes and prorates effectively.
Acts as a product consultant to business owners by articulating product features and benefits and making recommendations for new lines of business, upgrades or other services (Signature Support, Upware etc.) based on customer needs/interests. Supports growth of Comcast Business by introducing customer to new products, higher tiers of service etc. on all eligible calls.
Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and overtime as necessary.
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.
Employees at all levels are expected to:
Understand our Operating Principles; make them the guidelines for how you do your job.
Own the customer experience - think and act in ways that put our customers first, give them seamless digital options at every touchpoint, and make them promoters of our products and services.
Know your stuff - be enthusiastic learners, users and advocates of our game-changing technology, products and services, especially our digital tools and experiences.
Win as a team - make big things happen by working together and being open to new ideas.
Be an active part of the Net Promoter System - a way of working that brings more employee and customer feedback into the company - by joining huddles, making call backs and helping us elevate opportunities to do better for our customers.
Drive results and growth.
Respect and promote inclusion & diversity.
Do what's right for each other, our customers, investors and our communities.

summary: Support the ACTIVE Net system such that it is operational and meeting the needs of internal and external customers, including after-hours support.
job_description:
About Seattle Parks and Recreation

Seattle Parks and Recreation (SPR) is a national leader and innovator in the services and programs we provide to our residents who enjoy our public spaces such as parks, community centers, specialty gardens and swimming pools. Our mission is to provide welcoming and safe opportunities to play, learn, contemplate, and build community and promote responsible stewardship of the land. We promote healthy people, a healthy environment, and strong communities. We strive to deliver excellent customer service to each visitor and participant. SPR is also deeply committed to advancing the City of Seattle's Race and Social Justice Initiative (RSJI) by working to end institutional and structural racism.


About the Position

This position is part of a system administrator team of the Business Service Center (BSC). The BSC is made up of 7-10 staff that serve both the public and over 400 internal system users, providing administration, set up, and operational support for the Department's key recreation business software system, ACTIVE Net. The BSC also provides registration and customer account assistance, training and system support to staff, along with business process re-design, implementation, and data retrieval services for staff across Seattle Parks and Recreation.


Seattle Parks & Recreation is recruiting an organized, analytical, and self-motivated team member who can effectively manage multiple assignments and deadlines, support changing team priorities, and embraces diverse viewpoints. A successful candidate is an excellent writer and communicator and can translate technical concepts and terminology into non-technical terms.


This position will focus on operating, supporting, and documenting our business software systems, analyzing, and providing solutions to business problems, ensuring this system captures and integrates financial and transactional information with our Citywide financials, and producing data with interpretation from system perspective needed to manage the organization and best serve the community. Contact is primarily with the system administration team, system users, management, and technical personnel to identify problems, gather data, explain non-controversial decisions, and provide technical information, including some after-hours support.


This position will require an understanding of the Seattle Parks operations, policies, and business needs of various units along with an in-depth system knowledge. The Department is currently in the process of redeveloping business practices to work within new and updated operating models. The other focus of this position is to support new processes, procedures, and development of documentation for these and other system enhancements and optimization.
Job Responsibilities:
Support the ACTIVE Net system such that it is operational and meeting the needs of internal and external customers, including after-hours support.
Analyze, develop, maintain, and offer complete training plans and materials for all system users - includes initial and ongoing training in use of the application and associated equipment operation.
Create, prepare, and maintain documentation related to business processes, systems set up, and standard operating procedures involving considerable scope, complexity, and long-term commitments.
Develop or assist in the development, implementation and evaluation of automated and manual management information systems and reports.
Communicate with users/stakeholders to establish, understand, and document system business requirements and needs.
Effectively communicate with and act as a liaison between the many levels of system users, management, and other City and external technical teams.
Provide high level system user support both during and after business hours.
Analyze and resolve the more intricate system issues involving complex transaction sequences, problems having financial impacts, and/or situations affecting customer service.
Analyze problems and provide solutions related to system set up, business processes, or policy decisions.
Analyze, develop, maintain, and offer complete training plans and materials or all system users - includes initial and ongoing training in use of the application and associated equipment operation.
Extract, prepare, interpret data for management or in response to requests; recommend solutions as needed.
Performs other duties of a comparable level/type, as required.
Qualifications:
Minimum Qualifications
Requires two years in systems, operational, procedures, research, or analysis and a Bachelor's degree in business or public administration, finance, computer science or a related field (or a combination of education, training and/or experience that provides an equivalent background required to performs the work of the class).
You will be successful in this role if you have:

2+ years of experience in a matrix environment.
2+ years of experience booking and registration business software system, ideally with some system administrator experience.
Ability to work in a team with shared bodies or work.
Ability to listen and effectively communicate orally and in writing to all levels of an organization or the public, and interpret stakeholder needs, adjusting to accommodate requests when able.
Ability to solve problems collaboratively and creatively in a matrix work environment.
Proven analytical skills – ability to extract, display, and interpret data.
Technical writing and documentation experience.
Proven skills in MS Office applications including Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, SharePoint, and Teams.
Ability to work under pressure with multiple deadlines and varying priorities.
Ability to adapt to new situations and learn skills quickly.
Ability to work in an urban environment with people from a broad range of cultural backgrounds; experience with diversity including, but not limited to economic, ethnic, age, and gender.

Additional Information:
Why work at the City?

The City of Seattle recognizes every City employee must play a role in ending institutional and structural racism. Our culture is the result of our behavior, our personal commitments, and the ways that we courageously share our perspectives and encourage others to do the same. To cultivate an antiracist culture, we seek employees who will engage in the Race and Social Justice Initiative by working to dismantle racist policies and procedures, unlearn the way things have always been done, and provide equitable processes and services.


Applications will be accepted for this position until 4:00pm Pacific Time on Tuesday, February 22, 2022. To be considered for this position, in addition to completing your application fully, please attach:

A PDF of your current resume
Cover Letter
This hiring process involves a background check of conviction and arrest records in compliance with Seattle’s Fair Chance Employment Ordinance, SMC 14.17. Applicants will be provided an opportunity to explain or correct background information.


Questions? Contact Jackie.huynh@seattle.gov

We provide healthcare coverage for children and adults through Medicaid and other medical programs, and we help ensure that children receive financial resources from both their parents through Child Support Services. The HFS Office of the Inspector General investigates, audits and reviews program activity to ensure the integrity of our programs is maintained.
HFS is committed to promoting and preserving a workplace culture that embraces diversity, equity, and inclusion. We welcome and value employees with different backgrounds, life experiences, and talents. It is the collective sum of our individual differences that provides a broad perspective, leading to greater innovation and achievement. job_description: Collegis Education is a marketing and technology education solutions company that offers industry-leading services for colleges and universities of every size in every sector. Using a proactive and data-driven approach, Collegis Education empowers institutions to make a broader impact by providing insights that help grow enrollments, improve student outcomes and optimize expenses. With several decades of experience working within the higher education industry, the team at Collegis Education was founded within the walls of a college and expanded to help change more lives through education. Currently, the infrastructures established by Collegis Education support more than 40,000 students nationwide. For more information about Collegis Education, please visit www.CollegisEducation.com.The Technical Support Solutions Specialist performs in-depth troubleshooting on day-to-day issues. They also serve as a point of contact for analyzing more complex issues that routinely affect the helpdesk. The Technical Service Solutions Specialist will perform problem determination, documentation, and training for the team to expedite resolution to common occurring issues that are not readily resolvable by Customer Service Associate. The Technical Service Solutions Specialist will also serve as a liaison and account owner for various Collegis partner accounts, through maintaining constant contact on unresolved issues, documentation for the PSC Knowledge Base, and arranging training as needed. They will serve as the front line communication pathway between PSC and Partner school technical representatives.The Technical Support Solutions Specialist will also serve as a contact of escalation approval for cases being escalated outside of the PSC. Additionally, the Technical Service Solutions Specialist serve as a Subject Matter Expert on various assigned technologies ensuring documentation is up-kept and PSC Employees are trained. The Technical Service Solutions Specialist will lastly serve as the team captain ensuring ownership of all contact methods inbound and outbound to the Personal support Center. The Technical Service Solutions Specialist also has the opportunity to focus on larger projects, often requiring a level of engagement across both Collegis and Partner Schools.Primary Responsibilities, Essential Functions and Requirements: Communication & Professionalism: The Technical Support Solutions Specialist serves as a communications expert between internal and external teams. summary: You will spearhead the work of a group of 8 individuals ranging in experience and exposure to align our approach and deliver stellar internal customer support.
job_description:
This is a chance to bring your IT Infrastructure and operations knowledge to support supply chain management and the people involved. If you want to be a catalyst that takes us along our next exciting digital transformation, join us as a Director, IT Services.
Descartes Unites the People and Technology that Move the World
The need for efficient, secure, and agile supply chains and logistics operations has become ever more critical and complex. By combining innovative technology, powerful trade intelligence and the reach of our network, Descartes helps get goods, information, transportation assets, and people where they're needed, when they're needed.
We're one of the most broadly deployed logistics and supply chain technology companies in the world. More than 22,000 customers around the globe use our cloud-based solutions to transform the way they move inventory and information to enhance productivity, better serve customers, thrive competitively, keep pace with evolving regulations, and respond to rapidly changing market conditions.
Descartes is publicly traded (Nasdaq:DSGX, TSX:DSG) with headquarters in Waterloo, Ontario, Canada, and offices and partners around the world. With record financial performance for more than 16 years, we lead the industry in innovation investment. Every day, logistics service providers, manufacturers, retailers, distributors, and other logistics-intensive businesses of all sizes rely on our scale, stability, and comprehensive solution footprint to move what's most important to them.
We're growing fast and invite you to join our amazing team.
The opportunity
Reporting to the SVP IT Services, we are looking for a Director, IT to join the team. You will focus on aligning the needs, timing, investment, and delivery of IT Business Services across the organization. You will both set the path and actively participate to ensure ongoing requirements from all parts of the business are reflected in IT services.
This is a chance to apply your people and process leadership on a large scale with a significant impact, resulting in the success of your team, our company, and ultimately, our clients.
What's in it for you
Empowerment and influence. You want to step up the challenge of leading and growing a team within a flexible organizational framework, where your experience and knowledge will be respected and heard. This is an opportunity to bring a team together and take our IT Business Systems to the next level. It's a chance to play a critical role in our growth, drawing on your expertise to implement scalable processes and a new service structure.
Professional advancement. At Descartes, we value the contributions that each of our employees makes towards achieving our corporate goals. We strive to ensure that each team member has the tools and support they need to make valuable contributions. This will be your chance to truly map out your career in tandem with our continued growth as a company. You will have the chance to collaborate with and learn from globally recognized industry leaders who pride themselves in delivering quality services and market-leading innovations.
Your priorities
Create a responsive and effective IT Services team. You will spearhead the work of a group of 8 individuals ranging in experience and exposure to align our approach and deliver stellar internal customer support. You will mentor and coach them on the best ways to address requests and incidents, from the functionality of hardware, software, and systems to knowledge sharing, to obtaining and implementing new tools.
Cross-team collaboration. You will work closely with multiple departments to understand their current and future technology needs. You will oversee the collection of business requirements, and align solution needs to existing or new products. You will work closely with business partners to set and meet success factors, and fulfill operational commitments.
Corporate governance and compliance. You will apply your insights in technology ecosystem management at the enterprise level to optimize our data management processes. You will stay up to date with governance requirements and ahead of best practices.
Vendor management. You will build relationships with third-party vendors, negotiate the best deals, and ensure IT-related purchases meet the business area's needs requesting new tools or technologies. You will create a vendor onboarding process to align third-party behaviour with our best practices.
What you bring
The education and experience. You have a degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, or the equivalent work experience. You have 5 years of progressive experience in technology, including managing a team of IT Specialists and Business Analysts, ideally in an enterprise or globally-dispersed environment. You have expertise in the R&D of tools, trends, and methodologies, combined with your broader understanding of IT services and cloud infrastructure fundamentals. You have been part of building a strategy to improve and align cross-department business needs and technical requirements with new and existing tools and solutions.
The project management. You have experience planning and delivering complex implementation projects, from the proposal and budget to resources and timing of deliverables.
The people leadership. You can direct the work of a diverse group, remove roadblocks, manage conflict, and identify gaps in skills and resources to effectively manage the team's work. You practice active listening and empathetic engagement across diverse perspectives. You are a champion of your team and your own ideas, able to adopt the best idea but defend your own choices.
The drive. You are tenacious and have finely tuned troubleshooting abilities, diving into problems, analyzing situations, and innovating solutions. You continuously pursue new technologies and can quickly learn new tools.
The interpersonal skills. You have flexible and effective communication skills. You can build strong internal and external relationships and engage stakeholders at all levels.
Making an Impact
We succeed when our customers succeed so, for us, results are everything. Descartes' logistics and supply chain solutions help automate, streamline and secure the flow of goods and information in ways that result in a significant positive impact on the environment. In 2020, we helped our customers save over 552 thousand metric tons of CO2, 1.86 billion sheets of paper, and 727 million liters of fuel.
Descartes has a deep sense of environmental responsibility. Join a team that's committed to working with customers to conserve resources and enhance sustainability.
Network | Applications | Intelligence| Innovation
Our cloud-based solutions improve logistics and supply chain productivity, performance, and security. Descartes' Logistics Technology Platform innovatively combines the world's most expansive logistics network with the industry's broadest array of logistics management applications and most comprehensive offering of global trade related intelligence.
Network: The Descartes Global Logistics Network™ manages the real-time flow of commercial, logistics, customs and product information. It spans more than 160 countries and connects hundreds of thousands of organizations in logistics and transportation, manufacturing, distribution, retail, government, ecommerce and business services.
Applications: Customers use our modular, cloud-based applications to route, schedule, track and measure delivery resources; plan, allocate and execute shipments; rate, audit and pay transportation invoices; access global trade data; file customs and security documents for imports and exports; and complete numerous other logistics processes
Intelligence: Our global trade intelligence solutions and services enable organizations to work smarter by making better, data -driven business and supply chain decisions.
Innovation: We're focused on transforming new ideas and feedback from our customers and in-house domain experts into real-world innovations. New developments in the areas of IoT, machine learning, AI and analytics are enhancing the ability of our solutions to solve problems and process more information in new and complex ways.
Today's supply chains are more connected, complex and moving faster than ever. To meet this challenge, Descartes is leading digital transformation for companies of all sizes. We invite you to join our epic journey.
Join Us
As we scale, we're looking for new doers, collaborators and innovators to join Descartes in uniting the people and technology that move the world as the Global Leader in Logistics and Supply Chain Technology.
We're entrepreneurial, hardworking, geeky-in-a-good way problem solvers. Guided by our values, we nurture a TEAM focused culture that invests in people and creates opportunities for advancement across a broad spectrum of career paths. We prioritize work-life balance and foster an environment with the space to take ownership, to be heard, and to carve a path for your individual accomplishments to help drive our success. At Descartes, everyone has a voice and the best argument wins, regardless of who makes it.
We offer competitive compensation, great benefits, remote and flexible work hours, and the opportunity to join a company on an awesome mission with a great existing team and trajectory.
If you feel you have 70% of the qualifications we are looking for, and Descartes sounds like the team and the mission you want to be part of, apply now. We can't promise it will be a fit, but we do promise to consider your experience.
Due to COVID-19, we've implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by phone or video (Microsoft TEAMS) and are onboarding new hires remotely. We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we're all in this together.
We are an Equal Employment employer. We do not discriminate in hiring on the basis of sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, protected status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, provincial, or local law. For more information about our commitment to equal employment opportunity, please review our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics at Descartes.com.
Descartes is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to job applicants with disabilities. Applicants in North America with a disability who require a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process can email us at hrna@descartes.com. Provide your name and contact information along with the accommodation needed to assist you with the application process. Your request will be responded to as soon as possible. Reasonable accommodations will be determined on a case-by-case basis.

summary: As an IT Project Manager at HealthiVibe (a division of CorEvitas), you will guide multiple projects to completion simultaneously using your attention to detail,…
job_description:
IT Project Manager, HealthiVibe (a division of CorEvitas) – Fully Remote
As an IT Project Manager at HealthiVibe (a division of CorEvitas), you will guide multiple projects to completion simultaneously using your attention to detail, proactiveness, critical thinking, and proven project management experience. You will be a key player in a small but dynamic technology group. You will use knowledge of IT systems and process to drive project delivery by proactively following up with various stakeholders and working with the IT team to schedule work appropriately.
This is a fully remote position where you’ll have a chance to take the lead and make an impact. You’ll operate in a fast-paced environment with diverse and interesting projects. You’ll have a friendly, experienced, and talented team around you.
Your responsibilities will include:
Act as primary liaison between Operations and IT at a project level, proactively identifying project needs and following up to ensure completion.
Independently work through any problems/obstacles and critically think through resolutions for project implementation
Independently work with various stakeholders to determine and manage IT project scope, timelines, and deliverables as well as incorporate requirements into the process
Manage resource constraints and communicate project timelines and responsibilities within the IT group
Effectively manage risks, issues, and actions related to IT deliverables and communicate status of these to project stakeholders
Develop and maintain strong working knowledge of IT systems and capabilities.
Create awareness among operation team about processes and requirements

Your key strengths include:
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to assess and document IT project needs
Ability to collaborate well with various stakeholders
Demonstrated ability to juggle multiple projects at once
Strict attention to detail
Ability to pivot and prioritize effectively
Working knowledge of web-based technology systems

Additional Experience and Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree and 1 - 3 years of IT project management experience in pharmaceutical technology preferred, or an equivalent combination of education and experience that gives the individual the necessary knowledge, skills, and abilities to perform the job.

About CorEvitas
CorEvitas is the built-for-purpose gold-standard provider of real-world evidence. CorEvitas provides a holistic approach to capturing real-world data through patient-centered solutions including clinical registries, patient insight studies, biospecimen solutions and specialty electronic health record (EHR) data. Providing curated data while leveraging a cloud-based secure technology platform enables the company to aggregate and process longitudinal data at scale and handle a broad spectrum of clinical and patient-reported outcomes. Leveraging these data and analytic services, CorEvitas helps biopharmaceutical companies demonstrate the value of their products to clinicians, patients, payers, and regulators.
We operate eight major autoimmune and inflammatory registries across the US, Canada, and Japan, collecting data from nearly 500 clinical sites. In addition to our registry operations, we consist of additional specialty teams: HealthiVibe, the patient experience unit, complements and strengthens our disease registries by providing market-leading expertise in supporting innovative, evidence-based patient engagement initiatives across the entire product lifecycle. Our HealthUnlocked technology platform hosts over 1.4 million patients in hundreds of condition-specific communities and significantly enhances the depth and breadth of patient experiential data. Through our Health iQ division, CorEvitas has access to a broad range of UK-based and international data sets enabling us to understand market access issues, including clinical utilization, capacity planning, and cost optimization. Vestrum Health, a leader in data analytics of retinal practice EHR, provides insightful views of retinal diseases across the drug life cycle. CorEvitas is an Audax Private Equity portfolio company.
CorEvitas is proud to provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, pregnancy, age, national origin, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, genetic information, or any other protected classification. Minorities, women, LGBTQ candidates, Veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

summary: Our Project Services organization supports Schwab business goals through the delivery of projects spanning technology, operations, business continuity, and…
job_description:
Your Opportunity
Our Project Services organization supports Schwab business goals through the delivery of projects spanning technology, operations, business continuity, and offshore management. We collaborate across a matrixed organization to deliver through efficient, focused and predictable project execution of effective solutions to business problems and opportunities.
What you are good at
As a recognized specialist inside Schwab, the program manager is responsible for stewarding major business programs and projects which deliver strategic and groundbreaking change to one or business functions by providing leadership and direction to assigned projects or programs with budgets up to $5M. Reports to the Managing Director (Staffing Leader). In a matrixed organization, performs project and program management functions on assigned initiatives under the general direction of the Project Services IT Managing Director, (Program Director) or Vice President.
Program and Project Management
Provide overall program leadership, guidance, and handle all aspects of a given program, including requirements gathering, business case creation, planning, implementation and closing.
Work in collaboration with other team members including developers, Scrum Masters, Product Owners and others using Agile, traditional (Waterfall) or hybrid product development approaches.
Work with stakeholders across the organization to ensure the coordination and support required to deliver material and measurable business outcomes.
Drive process, content and business impact for large, sophisticated projects.
Develop resourcing strategies to ensure optimum support for projects and for the day-to-day operational activities
Review program budget variance and scope change requests, and participate in the budget-resolution process
Ensure that the scope of the projects within the program align with business priorities
Handle program-level risks and interdependencies
Provide program reporting and status to senior management
Maintain excellent relationships with all levels of the matrix organization
Ensure program/project financials adhere to and align with budgetary expectations; Run to a plan; Report out to interpersonal executives on risk, financials, and other key dimensions; Ensure individual project forecasts are accurate, and that variances are advanced appropriately
Team Leadership and Interaction
Exemplify servant leadership. Exercise effective influence without formal authority.
As assigned, provide direct leadership of a team of Project Services employees and/or contractors to successfully execute the program in an efficient and coordinated fashion. Proactively set performance expectations and help project managers and subordinates handle expectations of delivery and requirements, yielding consistent results. Provide constructive performance feedback, assessments and development recommendations to people leaders in the manner specified.
Make decisions on what the project team needs to do and provide effective delegation at the appropriate level of detail and specificity.
Support and mentor project managers and project coordinators within the program
Cultivate a culture of proactive, fact-based decision-making, transparency, agility and business value creation.
Identify and develop talent both within your team as well as participate in a broader program to develop our next generation of project management talent.
Lead others to solve issues of diverse scope
Collaborate with customers, peers, account leaders and external and internal partners
Interact with high level individual contributors, managers, directors, VPs and key executive-level employees.
Provide steady leadership in the face of uncertainty, change, and bold deadlines common to a rapidly growing company with an evolving business model.
Process Leadership, Analysis and Problem-solving
Act independently to settle methods and procedures on new or special assignments
Use sophisticated analytical thought to exercise judgment and identify innovative solutions
Lead multiple highly sophisticated projects of diverse scope where analysis requires an understanding of current business trends.
Decisions influence the direction of and prioritization for business unit operations and may have a firm-wide reach
Understand the up- and down-stream impact of changes and proposals which often result in global process improvements
What you have
Bachelor’s degree plus 10+ years of project management work experience preferably but not required within the financial services industry.
Project management certification preferred.
Business Outcomes orientation with a focus on delivery and strategy execution.
Proven experience in
Project, program and portfolio management including processes, roles, responsibilities and tools;
Current industry trends and evolving practices and how to optimal provide recommendations on how they may be operationalized internally;
Technology, strategy and planning practices;
Leading business partners and staff through highly complex and innovative projects with company-wide impact;
Creating industry leading processes by handling implementation from resource allocation, progress tracking, change and control, testing, and training to on-time delivery within budget;
Building high-functioning teams in the role of manager, team leader, or team member;
